conclusion: To determine the speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds, we need to analyze the given acceleration-time graph.
The graph shows the acceleration of the elevator as a function of time.
We need to find the total displacement of the elevator over the first 60 seconds by integrating the acceleration with respect to time.

The acceleration-time graph can be divided into several segments: (1) From t = 0 to t = 1 second: a = 2 m/s^2, (2) From t = 1 to t = 4 seconds: a = 2 m/s^2, (3) From t = 4 to t = 5 seconds: a = 2 m/s^2, (4) From t = 5 to t = 55 seconds: a = -2 m/s^2, (5) From t = 55 to t = 56 seconds: a = -2 m/s^2, (6) From t = 56 to t = 59 seconds: a = -2 m/s^2, (7) From t = 59 to t = 60 seconds: a = -2 m/s^2.
We need to find the velocity at t = 60 seconds. The velocity is the integral of the acceleration with respect to time.
The velocity at any time t is given by v(t) = ∫ a(t) dt.
